H0.text: Compounds are what a molecule forms when it is separated into its component parts.

H1.text: Atoms are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

H2.text: Protons are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

H3.text: Ions are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

A4.text: A chemical bond is the association of atoms or ions to form molecules, crystals, and other structures.

A5.text: Covalent bonds often result in the formation of small collections of better-connected atoms called molecules

A6.text: It can be defined as the standard enthalpy change when A−B is cleaved by homolysis to give fragments A and B, which are usually radical species.
